title.rendered: An Array of Authors and Books Take Spotlight at The Los Angeles Times Festival of Books in Booth 153 in the Gold Zone

content.rendered:
Author and children at Black Chateau at LA TIMES Festival of Books

Black Chateau and Books That Make You graphic for LA TIMES FOB 2024

Black Chateau Marketing and Public Relations for Authors

Books That Make You Logo

Booklovers invited to meet BookFest Award Winners, debut authors, and familiar faces with hosts Black Château and Books That Make You April 21st and 22nd, 2024

We’re back in booth 153 in the Gold Zone and invite booklovers and everyone attending this spectacular bookish event to swing by. There will be authors signing books, giveaways, and lots of surprises.”

— Black Château Enterprises founder Desireé Duffy

LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA, UNITED STATES, March 26, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ — Black Château and Books That Make You host an array of authors and books at The Los Angeles Times Festival of Books. BookFest Award winners, debut authors, as well as many familiar faces and literary legends will be spotlighted in Booth 153 in the Gold Zone. The Los Angeles Times Festival of Books is one of the largest literary events in the United States and takes place on the University of Southern California Campus April 21st and 22nd, 2024.

“We’re back in booth 153 in the Gold Zone and invite booklovers and everyone attending this spectacular bookish event to swing by. There will be authors signing books, giveaways, and lots of surprises in our tent,” says Black Château Enterprises founder Desireé Duffy.

Authors and books featured in the Booth 153 in the Gold Zone include:

Terence Ang – “Emerging From the Dark: Stroke…The Untold Stories; Strength in Motion: The Next Chapter of Stroke”

April Armstrong – “The Day One Executive: A Guidebook to Stand Out in Your Career Starting Now”

Laura Casselman – “Trust Your Increments: How Small, Consistent Steps Can Lead to Massive Success”

Donna Conrad – “The Last Magdalene: Book One of the Magdalene Chronicles”

Dr. Paul Corona – “The Corona Protocol”

Julie Elkins – “Thunder’s Grand Adventure”

Dan Flanigan – “An American Tragedy”

Rebecca Heidt – “Acceptance: The Beginning”

Doug Kari – “The Berman Murders”

Kaitlyn E. Kenealy – “Healing is Messy AF: A Workbook about Investing in Yourself and Addressing Your Mental Health”

Mushin Knott – “The Adventures of Henry and Eulalie”

Michele Kwasniewski – “Rising Star: Book One in the Rise and Fall of Dani Truehart Series”

Liz Leonard – “Frizzy Lizzy”

Lee Lindauer – “Irrational Fears”; “The Sava Steps”

Kelly Anne Manuel – “The Night Quiet”; “The Inclusive All”; “My Name Is Wing”; “The Emotion Commotion Locomotion”

Caren Simpson McVicker – “Henderson House”

Pamela Mshana – “girls in search of cover”

J. Mendez Napier – “White Horse Red Blood”

Korynn Newville – “indiscernible elements: Calcium”

John Palisano – “Try Not to Die: In The Wild West”

S. F. Richards – “The November Molecule”

Mike Robinson – “Walking the Dusk; Ancient Tides Ashore”

Risa Sheppard – “Mindful Movement: Heal Your Back Pain with BAM Therapy”

Dr. David Tannenbaum – “Mindful Movement: Heal Your Back Pain with BAM Therapy”

Ashley W. Slaughter – “Of Legends and Roses”

Melissa Stuart – “Butterfly Love from Above”

Darlene Taylor – “It’s Not About Us: A Co-parenting Survival Guide to Taking the High Road”

WilD – “The Perfect Revenge: The Dragonfly Rises”

 

Visit Books That Make You’s website for the schedule, including signing dates and times, for Booth 153 in the Gold Zone.

Previous attendees and authors alike have described their encounters as uplifting and inspiring, making meaningful connections while creating cherished bookish memories that extend beyond signed copies. The Los Angeles Times Festival of Books reports that approximately 150,000 people attend each year. Their website invites attendees to also check out one-on-one conversations, panel discussions, readings by authors, musical performances, TV and moving screenings, and much more.

Follow Black Château’s social media sites: Facebook, Instagram and Twitter/X and on Books That Make You’s sites: TikTok, Facebook and Instagram for updates, pictures, and videos. Hashtags include: #BTMY #LATFoB.

 

About Black Château and Books That Make You:

Black Château is an award-winning marketing and public relations agency. It specializes in promoting authors, books, small presses, personality brands, and creative individuals from around the world with a full spectrum of services. The company’s motto is: We believe in storytellers. Black Château’s sister company, Books That Make You, is a Webby Award-winning multi-media brand that promotes books through its website, radio show/podcast, and social media channels. For more, visit www.BlackChateauEnterprises.com and www.BooksThatMakeYou.com.

Desiree Duffy
Black Chateau
+1 213-444-1958
email us here
Visit us on social media:
Facebook
Twitter
LinkedIn
Instagram

You just read:

News Provided By

March 26, 2024, 17:45 GMT
